creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
Old: "By default, all of the properties of the current project will be available
in the new project. Alternatively, you can set the inheritAll attribute to false
and only "user" properties (i.e., those passed on the command-line) will be
passed to the new project. In either case, the set of properties passed to the
new project will override the properties that are set in the new project (See
also the property task)."
Proposed: "By default, all of the properties of the current project will be
available in the new project. Alternatively, you can set the inheritAll
attribute to false and only "user" properties (i.e., those passed on the
command-line) will be passed to the new project. In either case, the set of
properties passed to the new project will override the properties that are set
in the new project (See also the property task). Also, if a user property is set
on the command line and also <param..> is used in to set the same property, the
command-line value will be used for the new project no matter what
<param ...> says in the current project."
